column2: Retailers see 'click and mortar' as way to beat Amazon PARIS Traditional stores can take on e-commerce and keep their major role by reinventing themselves faster to best combine shopping in stores and online
Ex-AIG CEO Greenberg wins temporary delay in NY fraud case NEW YORK
column3: Oct 10 Former American International Group Chief Executive Maurice "Hank" Greenberg on Thursday won a short reprieve from New York's case accusing him of orchestrating sham transactions at AIG.

column2: AT&T; narrows options for new customers to data-share plans NEW YORK
column3: Oct 11 AT&T; Inc plans to only sell its new customers Mobile Share plans
column4: which involve higher data fees but allow subscribers to share their data allowance among multiple devices.

column2: More US rig efficiency seen favoring oil service giants Oct 11 New data on U.S. onshore oil and gas wells on Friday underlined a trend in which oilfield services companies that perform a variety of work at drilling sites are able to secure more business despite no growth in the bellwether rig count.

column2: European shares rise on prospect of U.S. debt deal
column4: Oct 11 European shares rose on Friday
column5: lifted by prospects of a deal to end the U.S. debt stalemate.

column2: Hulu in talks with Fox TV executive for CEO role -source LOS ANGELES
column3: Oct 10 Hulu is negotiating with Fox television executive Mike Hopkins to name him chief executive officer of the video streaming company
column4: a person with knowledge of the discussions said on Thursday.

column2: Sam's Club bets new merchandise will make customers buy more ROMEOVILLE
column4: Oct 11 Sam's Club is trying to stand out against its larger
column5: faster-growing rival Costco Wholesale Corp with trendier holiday merchandise this year
column6: hoping that new goods will spur its members to spend more.

column2: Dow to sell polypropylene licensing business to W.R. Grace for $500 mln Oct 11 U.S. chemical maker Dow Chemical Co  said it will sell its polypropylene licensing and catalyst business to smaller peer W.R. Grace & Co for $500 million.
AstraZeneca to co-promote J&J; prostate cancer drug in Japan LONDON
column3: Oct 11 AstraZeneca has signed a deal to co-promote Johnson & Johnson's novel prostate cancer medicine in Japan
column4: giving the British company a new drug revenue stream and bolstering its Japanese presence.

column2: UPDATE 2-Raytheon wins U.S. Navy radar deal worth up to $1.6 bln WASHINGTON
column3: Oct 10 The U.S. Navy on Thursday awarded Raytheon Co a contract valued at up to $1.6 billion to design a next-generation air and missile defense radar for use on Arleigh Burke destroyers starting in 2016.

column2: UPDATE 2-Raytheon wins U.S. Navy radar deal worth up to $1.6 bln WASHINGTON
column3: Oct 10 The U.S. Navy on Thursday awarded Raytheon Co a contract valued at up to $1.6 billion to design a next-generation air and missile defense radar for use on Arleigh Burke destroyers starting in 2016.

column2: Dow to sell polypropylene licensing business to W.R. Grace for $500 mln Oct 11 U.S. chemical maker Dow Chemical Co  said it will sell its polypropylene licensing and catalyst business to smaller peer W.R. Grace & Co for $500 million.
UPDATE 1-Starbucks CEO starts petition against government shutdown NEW YORK
column3: Oct 10 Starbucks Corp plans to circulate petitions to customers across the United States urging lawmakers to reopen the partially closed government and avoid a looming default
column4: the coffee chain's CEO Howard Schultz said on Thursday.

column2: Sam's Club bets new merchandise will make customers buy more ROMEOVILLE
column4: Oct 11 Sam's Club is trying to stand out against its larger
column5: faster-growing rival Costco Wholesale Corp with trendier holiday merchandise this year
column6: hoping that new goods will spur its members to spend more.

column2: Wells Fargo profit rises 13 pct after reserve releaseUPDATE 2-Wells Fargo profit rises but mortgage banking income fallsUS STOCKS-Wall Street edges up with eyes on WashingtonAnalysis: Wells wealth sector goosed by asset-based fees; commissions fallWells Fargo profit rises but investors worry about growth Profit at Wells Fargo & Co  rose by a better-than-expected 13 percent in the third quarter
column3: as the largest U.S. mortgage lender made up for a decline in that business by releasing a large chunk of money set aside for bad loans.  Wells Fargo profit rises but investors worry about growth Profit at Wells Fargo & Co  rose by a better-than-expected 13 percent in the third quarter
column4: as the largest U.S. mortgage lender made up for a decline in that business by releasing a large chunk of money set aside for bad loans.
